VIII.i.3.C.9.g
.
Conditions Not Covered Due To Birth-Related Injury or Fetal/Neonatal Infirmity
Conditions that are due to a fetal or neonatal infirmity with well-established causes or that are miscellaneous pediatric conditions are not covered birth defects.Â  These include, but are not limited to
asthma and other allergies
effects of maternal rubella, toxoplasmosis, syphilis, or other maternal infection during pregnancy
fetal alcohol syndrome or fetal effects of maternal drug abuse
hyaline membrane disease
maternal-infant blood incompatibility
neonatal infections
neonatal jaundice
post-infancy deafness/hearing impairment (onset after the age of one year)
prematurity, and
refractive disorders of the eye.
title: M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart i, Chapter 3, Section C - Eligibility and Development
citation: Part VIII, Subpart i, Chapter 3, Section C
